entries.name: new(ole, event) #=> WIN32OLE_EVENT object.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns OLE event object. The first argument specifies WIN32OLE object. The second argument specifies OLE event name.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_EVENT#handler=click to toggle source
entries.desc: sets event handler object. If handler object has onXXX method according to XXX event, then onXXX method is called when XXX event occurs.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_EVENT#on_event([event]){...}click to toggle source
entries.desc: Defines the callback event. If argument is omitted, this method defines the callback of all events. If you want to modify reference argument in callback, return hash in callback. If you want to return value to OLE server as result of callback use `return' or :return.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_EVENT#on_event_with_outargs([event]){...}click to toggle source
entries.desc: Defines the callback of event. If you want modify argument in callback, you could use this method instead of #on_event.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_EVENT#unadvise → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: disconnects OLE server. If this method called, then the WIN32OLE_EVENT object does not receive the OLE server event any more. This method is trial implementation.
